_meta: Synthetic email corpus for ThunderRAG quality testing. Each entry has rfc822 (raw email text) and metadata for the harness.

emails.description: Alice tells Bob the Project Falcon launch date is March 15, 2025
emails.rfc822:
From: Alice Chen <alice@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Project Falcon launch date
Message-Id: <falcon-launch-001@test.example.com>
Date: Wed, 05 Feb 2025 09:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

The launch date for Project Falcon is confirmed for March 15, 2025.
Please make sure the QA team is ready by March 10.

We also need the staging environment validated before the 12th.
Let me know if you foresee any blockers.

Thanks,
Alice

emails.description: Bob replies to Alice confirming QA readiness, mentions dry run on March 12
emails.rfc822:
From: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
To: Alice Chen <alice@acme.com>
Subject: Re: Project Falcon launch date
Message-Id: <falcon-reply-002@test.example.com>
Date: Wed, 05 Feb 2025 14:30:00 +0000
In-Reply-To: <falcon-launch-001@test.example.com>
References: <falcon-launch-001@test.example.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Alice,

Got it. QA will be ready by March 10. I've also scheduled a dry run for March 12.
The staging environment is already set up and passing basic smoke tests.

One concern: we still need the API keys for the payment gateway integration.
Can you check with Dave's team?

Best,
Bob

> On Wed, 05 Feb 2025 at 09:00, Alice Chen <alice@acme.com> wrote:
> The launch date for Project Falcon is confirmed for March 15, 2025.
> Please make sure the QA team is ready by March 10.

emails.description: Carol invites team to Q1 budget review, To + Cc
emails.rfc822:
From: Carol Davis <carol@acme.com>
To: Engineering Team <engineering@acme.com>
Cc: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>, Finance <finance@acme.com>
Subject: Q1 budget review meeting - Feb 20
Message-Id: <budget-meeting-003@test.example.com>
Date: Mon, 10 Feb 2025 08:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi team,

Reminder: the Q1 budget review meeting is scheduled for February 20, 2025 at 2pm in Conference Room B.

Please bring your department expense reports and any budget change requests.
We need to finalize allocations before the March board meeting.

Agenda:
1. Q1 actuals vs. plan
2. Headcount requests
3. Infrastructure spending
4. Travel budget adjustments

Regards,
Carol

emails.description: Dave urgently reports production server outage to Bob, ASAP action needed
emails.rfc822:
From: Dave Wilson <dave@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Cc: Ops Team <ops@acme.com>
Subject: URGENT: Production server down - immediate action needed
Message-Id: <server-down-004@test.example.com>
Date: Tue, 11 Feb 2025 03:15:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Bob,

Production server us-east-1 is DOWN. All customer-facing APIs are returning 503.
This started at 3:05 AM UTC. We need someone to investigate ASAP.

The monitoring dashboard shows:
- CPU usage spiked to 100% at 3:04 AM
- Database connections exhausted
- No recent deployments in the last 24h

I've already paged the on-call team but haven't gotten a response.
Please escalate if you can.

-- Dave

emails.description: HR newsletter about 2025 holiday schedule, Bcc to all staff
emails.rfc822:
From: HR Department <hr@acme.com>
To: All Staff <allstaff@acme.com>
Bcc: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: 2025 Company Holiday Schedule
Message-Id: <holiday-schedule-005@test.example.com>
Date: Fri, 03 Jan 2025 10:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Dear colleagues,

Please find below the official 2025 company holiday schedule:

- Jan 1: New Year's Day
- Jan 20: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
- Feb 17: Presidents' Day
- May 26: Memorial Day
- Jul 4: Independence Day
- Sep 1: Labor Day
- Nov 27-28: Thanksgiving
- Dec 24-25: Christmas
- Dec 31: New Year's Eve (half day)

Please plan your PTO requests accordingly.

Best regards,
HR Department

emails.description: Eve sends Bob Q1 report with attachment
emails.rfc822:
From: Eve Park <eve@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Q1 financial report attached
Message-Id: <q1-report-006@test.example.com>
Date: Thu, 13 Feb 2025 11:30:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_Q1Report"

------=_Part_Q1Report
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

Please find attached the Q1 financial report for your review before the budget meeting.

Key highlights:
- Revenue: $2.4M (up 15% YoY)
- Operating expenses: $1.8M (within budget)
- Net margin: 25%

Let me know if you have questions.

Eve

------=_Part_Q1Report
Content-Type: application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="Q1-Financial-Report-2025.xlsx"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

UEsDBBQAAAAIAA==
------=_Part_Q1Report--

emails.description: Frank starts a thread about vendor contract renewal
emails.rfc822:
From: Frank Lee <frank@acme.com>
To: Grace Kim <grace@acme.com>
Cc: Heidi Tanaka <heidi@acme.com>
Subject: Vendor contract renewal - CloudStore Inc.
Message-Id: <vendor-original-007@test.example.com>
Date: Mon, 03 Feb 2025 09:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Grace,

The CloudStore Inc. contract expires on March 31, 2025.
Their renewal proposal is $45,000/year (up from $38,000).

I think we should negotiate. Their competitor DataVault is offering similar storage at $35,000/year.
Can you prepare a comparison analysis?

Thanks,
Frank

emails.description: Grace replies with comparison analysis, quotes original
emails.rfc822:
From: Grace Kim <grace@acme.com>
To: Frank Lee <frank@acme.com>
Cc: Heidi Tanaka <heidi@acme.com>
Subject: Re: Vendor contract renewal - CloudStore Inc.
Message-Id: <vendor-reply1-008@test.example.com>
Date: Tue, 04 Feb 2025 14:00:00 +0000
In-Reply-To: <vendor-original-007@test.example.com>
References: <vendor-original-007@test.example.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Frank,

I've done the comparison. Here's what I found:

CloudStore:
- 5TB storage, 99.9% uptime SLA
- 24/7 phone support
- Already integrated with our systems
- Migration risk: none
- Cost: $45,000/yr

DataVault:
- 5TB storage, 99.5% uptime SLA
- Email-only support
- Would require 2-3 weeks migration
- Migration risk: moderate
- Cost: $35,000/yr

My recommendation: negotiate CloudStore down to $40,000 using the DataVault quote as leverage. The migration risk and downtime aren't worth the $5K savings.

Grace

> On Mon, 03 Feb 2025, Frank Lee wrote:
> The CloudStore Inc. contract expires on March 31, 2025.
> Their renewal proposal is $45,000/year (up from $38,000).
> I think we should negotiate. Their competitor DataVault is offering similar storage at $35,000/year.

emails.description: Heidi replies to thread, 3-deep, quotes both previous messages
emails.rfc822:
From: Heidi Tanaka <heidi@acme.com>
To: Frank Lee <frank@acme.com>, Grace Kim <grace@acme.com>
Subject: Re: Re: Vendor contract renewal - CloudStore Inc.
Message-Id: <vendor-reply2-009@test.example.com>
Date: Wed, 05 Feb 2025 10:00:00 +0000
In-Reply-To: <vendor-reply1-008@test.example.com>
References: <vendor-original-007@test.example.com> <vendor-reply1-008@test.example.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Agreed with Grace's analysis. I'll reach out to CloudStore's account manager today and push for $40K.

I also want to add a clause for automatic scaling if we exceed 5TB. Our data growth rate suggests we'll hit that ceiling by Q3.

-- Heidi

> On Tue, 04 Feb 2025, Grace Kim wrote:
> My recommendation: negotiate CloudStore down to $40,000 using the DataVault quote as leverage.
> The migration risk and downtime aren't worth the $5K savings.
>
>> On Mon, 03 Feb 2025, Frank Lee wrote:
>> The CloudStore Inc. contract expires on March 31, 2025.
>> Their renewal proposal is $45,000/year (up from $38,000).

emails.description: Mark emails Bob about a new hire starting
emails.rfc822:
From: Mark Johnson <mark@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: New hire starting Monday - Lisa Wong
Message-Id: <mark-topic1-010@test.example.com>
Date: Thu, 06 Feb 2025 09:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

Just a heads-up: Lisa Wong is joining the backend team this Monday, Feb 10.
She'll need access to the dev environment and a desk in Building 3.

Can you set up her accounts and assign her a buddy?

Thanks,
Mark

emails.description: Mark emails Bob about office renovation
emails.rfc822:
From: Mark Johnson <mark@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Office renovation schedule - Building 3
Message-Id: <mark-topic2-011@test.example.com>
Date: Fri, 07 Feb 2025 15:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Bob,

The Building 3 renovation is scheduled for March 3-14.
Your team will need to relocate to Building 1 during that period.

Please identify any equipment that can't be moved and we'll arrange alternatives.

Mark

emails.description: Mark emails Bob about the company offsite event
emails.rfc822:
From: Mark Johnson <mark@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Company offsite - April 5-6
Message-Id: <mark-topic3-012@test.example.com>
Date: Mon, 10 Feb 2025 11:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

The annual company offsite is happening April 5-6 at the Lakeside Resort.
Please RSVP by February 25 and indicate any dietary restrictions.

Mark

emails.description: Time-sensitive email with explicit deadline of Feb 28
emails.rfc822:
From: Nora Patel <nora@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Compliance audit documents needed by Feb 28
Message-Id: <deadline-013@test.example.com>
Date: Wed, 12 Feb 2025 09:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

The annual compliance audit is coming up. I need the following documents from your team by February 28, 2025:

1. Code review logs for Q4 2024
2. Security incident reports
3. Access control audit trail
4. Data retention policy acknowledgments

Please coordinate with your team leads to gather these. This deadline is firm - the auditors arrive March 3.

Thanks,
Nora

emails.description: Email referencing a previous email (the Falcon launch)
emails.rfc822:
From: Alice Chen <alice@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Cc: Dave Wilson <dave@acme.com>
Subject: API keys for Falcon - following up
Message-Id: <cross-ref-014@test.example.com>
Date: Fri, 07 Feb 2025 16:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Bob,

As discussed in my previous email about the Falcon launch, we need the payment gateway API keys before March 10.

I've checked with Dave's team and they say the keys are pending approval from the vendor.
Dave, can you provide an ETA?

We can't proceed with payment integration testing without them.

Alice

emails.description: An already-dealt-with email (will be marked processed after ingest)
emails.rfc822:
From: IT Support <it@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Password reset completed
Message-Id: <processed-015@test.example.com>
Date: Mon, 03 Feb 2025 12:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Bob,

Your VPN password has been reset as requested.
Your new temporary password is: TempPass2025!

Please change it within 24 hours by logging into the IT portal.

-- IT Support Team

emails.description: Most recent email from Alice (for temporal queries)
emails.rfc822:
From: Alice Chen <alice@acme.com>
To: Bob Martinez <bob@acme.com>
Subject: Updated Falcon timeline
Message-Id: <alice-recent-016@test.example.com>
Date: Thu, 13 Feb 2025 17:00:00 +0000
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Bob,

Quick update: the marketing team requested a 2-day delay for the Falcon launch.
New date is March 17, 2025 instead of March 15.

All other deadlines shift accordingly:
- QA ready: March 12 (was March 10)
- Dry run: March 14 (was March 12)

Sorry for the late change. Let me know if this causes issues.

Alice
